t: A House of Prayer for All
This*p is what the Lord*s says: Preserve*pn justice and do what is right, for*ln my salvation is coming soon, and*ln my righteousness will be revealed.
Happy*ln is the person who does this, the*ln son of man who holds it fast, who*ln keeps the Sabbath without desecrating it, and*ln keeps his hand from doing any evil.
No*pn foreigner who has joined himself to the Lord*s should*ln say, “The*ln Lord*s will exclude me from his people,” and*ln the eunuch should not say, “Look,*ln I am a dried-up tree.”
For*ln the Lord*s says this: “For*ln the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths, and*ln choose what pleases me, and*ln hold firmly to my covenant,
I*ln will give them, in my house and within my walls, a*ln memorial and a name better*ln than sons and daughters. I*ln will give each of them an everlasting name that*ln will never be cut off.

As*ln for the foreigners who join themselves to the Lord*s to*ln minister to him, to love the name of the Lord,*s and*ln to become his servants — all*ln who keep the Sabbath without desecrating it and*ln who hold firmly to my covenant —

I*ln will bring them to my holy mountain and*ln let them rejoice in my house of prayer. Their*ln burnt offerings and sacrifices will*ln be acceptable on my altar, for*ln my house will be called a house of prayer for*ln all nations.”
This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God,*s who*lg gathers the dispersed of Israel: “I*pn will gather to them still others besides*ln those already gathered.”
All*pn you animals of the field and forest, come*ln and eat!
Israel’s*ln watchmen are blind, all of them, they*ln know nothing; all*ln of them are mute dogs, they*ln cannot bark; they*ln dream, lie down, and*ln love to sleep.
These*ln dogs have fierce appetites; they*ln never have enough. And*ln they are shepherds who*ln have no discernment; all*ln of them turn to their own way, every*ln last one for his own profit.
“Come,*ln let me get some wine, let’s*ln guzzle some beer; and*ln tomorrow will be like today, only*ln far better!”
